bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Animal Health Act;
bee has the same meaning as in the Bee Regulation, B.C. Reg. 3/2015;
cappings has the same meaning as in the Bee Regulation, B.C. Reg. 3/2015;
comb has the same meaning as in the Bee Regulation, B.C. Reg. 3/2015;
farmed bird means a chicken, Cornish hen, duck, emu, goose, ostrich, partridge, pheasant, pigeon, quail, squab or turkey hatched or raised on a farm;
fur bearing animal has the same meaning as in the Fur Farm Regulation, B.C. Reg. 8/2015;
game has the same meaning as in the Game Farm Regulation, B.C. Reg. 5/2015;
hide has the same meaning as in the Livestock Licensing Regulation, B.C. Reg. 6/2015;
livestock has the same meaning as in the Livestock Licensing Regulation, B.C. Reg. 6/2015.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following are prescribed as animal products from bees for the purposes of the Act and the regulations made under it:
The following are prescribed as animal byproducts from bees for the purposes of the Act and the regulations made under it:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a queen cell, being a wax comb cell that contains a developing queen bee that is near to emerging.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Eggs from farmed birds are prescribed as animal products for the purposes of the Act and the regulations made under it.
Feathers from farmed birds are prescribed as animal byproducts for the purposes of the Act and the regulations made under it.
The following are prescribed as animal products from finfish for the purposes of the Act and the regulations made under it:
The following are prescribed as animal byproducts for the purposes of the Act and the regulations made under it:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: fertilizers and hydrolysates made from finfish;

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Milk from livestock or water buffalo, including butter, cream, cheese and other dairy products made from that milk, is prescribed as an animal product for the purposes of the Act and the regulations made under it.
The following are prescribed as animal byproducts for the purposes of the Act and the regulations made under it:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: blood, bones, bristle, hair, hides, hooves, horns and offal from livestock or water buffalo;

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Meat from farmed birds, finfish, crustaceans, molluscs, livestock or water buffalo is prescribed as an animal product for the purposes of the Act and the regulations made under it.

Non-fertilized ova and semen from farmed birds, finfish, crustaceans, molluscs, livestock, water buffalo or fur bearing animals are prescribed as animal byproducts for the purposes of the Act and the regulations made under it.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Animal Health Act, S.B.C. 2014, c. 16, section 93 (1) (c)]
